reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I write this as we are spending our second night at the Cove Motel. We were here two nights ago on our way to Cape Breton Island, and after staying on CBI one night and driving the Cabot Trail - we changed our plans to spend a second night up there, and instead came back here. The rooms are clean, the site and grounds are beautiful, and you are perched on the edge of the Canso Straight - within sight of the Causeway and ship locks.
reviews.title: Happy at The Cove

reviews.text: The personnel at the desk and restaurant are friendly and helpful. There is a small guest laundry that was handy to get our mid-trip washing done; and it is a dog-friendly property. We stayed in the motel section, and there are a number of cabins also facing the water. The room was quiet - granted, they were not full.
reviews.title: Clean & comfortable, but overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had dinner at their restaurant tonight, and were very pleased. My husband's steak was cooked correctly and was tasty, and my veggie pasta was also vey nice.
reviews.title: Motorcycle Friendly
Nice stay in cabin that could use updating
reviews.text: I would highly recommend The Cove to anyone for a layover, or a longer stay.

We stayed in the motel part, not the cabins. Room was average - clean and looked like it had been renovated recently. We made use of the laundry facilities on site which were handy. Did not eat at the restaurant as it seemed pricy and we were not hungry for a big meal. The location is nice, surrounded by water on three sides. Found the price quite high for what you got, in fact it was the most expensive on our trip through Nova Scotia, except for Halifax, and many of the less expensive ones included breakfast.
reviews.title: Rip off and cabin smelled of cat urine

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I did not know that quality Mom and Pop motels even existed anymore. This place was great. Rooms were very spacious, clean and comfortable. The bathroom was spotless and roomy. I think I got the best night's sleep ever on their comfortable bed. The attached restaurant has the best food in Nova Scotia and the front desk staff treated us like family. The Motel sits on a point in the river and the grounds are neatly manicured with benches and a wonderful view. For our trip next year, I am going to book this Motel first and then build my trip around it.
reviews.title: Best Mom and Pop motel ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great one-night stay at the Cove. Everyone was delightful and helpful. The restaurant right on the water with a view of the causeway was probably the only "waterfront" rstaurant we found in the area.
reviews.title: Better than it looks!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was good with excellent service.
reviews.title: Rustic, clean, comfortable cabin

reviews.text: We arrived at the Canso Causeway late on a drizzly, rainy Monday, and decided not to camp for the night. The Tourist Bureau found us a cabin at the Cove Motel. The cabin was very clean, beds comfortable, decor rather rustic. Staff was friendly and helpful, and as an extra surprise, the restaurant seafood was gourmet quality.
reviews.title: Beautiful view, quaint setting

reviews.text: We were on our way to Baddeck to tour the Cabot Trail on motorcycles, and we were behind schedule because of the rainy weather. It was beginning to get dark and we needed a place to stay for the night. We seen the sign for the Cove Motel and decided to stop. What a treat it was, the ladies at the front desk were especially helpful, even though the restaurant was closed at this time of night, they called the local pizza place to find out if they would deliver for us.
reviews.title: Excellent stop

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Definitely a special place - very serene, quiet, beautiful views. Simple accommodations, clean and good bed. The most surprising - a gourmet dinner in the restaurant and gorgeous views! My husband had the best fish and I had a superb pasta dish - first class! for such a small motel. Wonderful dinner and quiet comfortable stay. I would highly recommend this motel.
reviews.title: Special Place

likes.liked: — Easy access off highway, yet secluded through trees - beautiful location with superb views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Cove Motel is much more than you see in the photos on their website. From the second you turn onto the tree-lined drive you start to anticipate what may lie ahead.
reviews.title: I loved this kitchy motel!

likes.liked: — The quaintness. The location. the unexpectef beauty of the property. The gift shop.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is an incredible peninsula right on the Causeway.
reviews.title: Keep Driving to Baddeck

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room is basic, but very clean. The bed was comfortable. Our room faced the causeway so we could see the bridge to Cape Breton and it was nice to walk right outside and be on the water. My husband and I took a morning walk along the rocks on the peninsula and then back up the tree-lined drive.
reviews.title: Perfect picturesque stop before hitting Cape Breton
